raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Mitsukoooo!
System: So anyway...Can you dance?
User: no, can you?
System: Wow! I think I can, don't you?
User: no I cannot. What kind do you do?
System: Why not? Only the good kind.
User: not my cup of beer
System: Whose cup of beer is it?
User: yours
System: My what?
User: your cup of beer

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey there! How's your day going?
User: busy yours?
System: Mine's been pretty uneventful so far!
User: what are doing right now?
System: Just been playing a bit of Hearthstone, and now I'm listening to some music! What about you?
User: which music?
System: Just some random stuff on Spotify!
User: you have a paid subscription of it?
System: Yeah, it's really good!
User: how much does it cost?
System: It's  ⁇ 9.99 a month!
User: that's cheap!

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Oh hey. How's your day been?
User: It's good! Just went to the park to enjoy the sun. You?
System: The sun is a bit too bright for more. Maybe I'm on the verge of becoming a vampire.
User: Haha, beach season is coming! You need to look tan! What did you do indoors all day?
System: I mostly work. Sometimes I try looking at at beach photos and pretending that I'm actually going to the beach.
User: hahahaha, that's pretty funny. Ever thought of bringing your work things to the beach??
System: All the times. My work involves a few types of fish and a few types of nets. I just put the nets on the fish to see how the fish will react. Every time I do that, I think of going to the beach.
User: Hmm I see. It sounds like you work near the water already, no? Are you some kind of fish researcher?
System: Yes that's close. My research focuses on jellyfish and pufferfish. Many of them a poisonous, but if processed correctly, they would make hi-end foods. I try to find the best recipes to bring these fish to the tables.
User: Woah! This is very interesting! I have honestly never heard of such kind of work. Is it dangerous at all?

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hey, what's up?
User: How was the trip last weekend?
System: it was really fun. I had a great time with my family.
User: Nice, what all places did you cover?
System: Vietnam and Hongkong :) did you go any where last weekend?
User: I am actually attending cooking classes over the weekends.
System: ha! that sounds fund. what did you learn?
User: True! they started with some basic zucchini based dish. We may try cooking some italian dish later this week.
System: I love Italian, especially Pasta!
User: Nice! I hope to volunteer to cook for the team in our next team offsite :)
System: can't wait to try your food. why not cook this Thanksgiving? :)
User: Sure, I will love to invite you and your family for a meal over the holidays. Have you guys made any other plans?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How's it going?
User: Great, thanks
System: I'm glad to hear that. What are you up to?
User: I am planning of my vacation next week
System: Nice. Where are you going?
User: to Europe
System: Cool. Where in Europe?
User: probably Italy and Spain
System: Nice. You're going to have a great time.
User: thx! do you have any recommendation?
System: Italy: Rome, Venice, Florence Spain: Barcelona, Madrid, Tenerife, Malaga France: Paris, Amsterdam, Bruges Belgium: Antwerp, Bruges Austria: Vienna, Salzburg
User: wow, what a lot
System: The Netherlands: Amsterdam, Utrecht, Mechelen, Lagos, Brussels.
User: which is the best for you?
System: I've only been to Rome and Paris.
User: cool do you like them?
System: Rome was pretty nice, Paris was okay.
User: gotcha I will go to Paris
System: It's a cool city.
User: agree I really look forward to visiting the city
System: Did you see the Eiffel Tower?
User: not yet, have you?

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How are you? :D
User: i am good
System: Well, that's good to hear. :D
User: can you tell me the weather today
System: It's raining. You? :D
User: oh! where are you
System: I'm in Texas. :D You?
User: cool, i am in the bay area
System: Cool. Do you like it there?
User: yes
System: Well, I'm glad you like it. :D
User: have you been here
System: I haven't. :D
User: ok bye then

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi
User: Okay...so I need someone to help me though a scenario I've been pondering.
System: Sure, whats the scenario?
User: My partner's former friend invited me for lunch (they are not in good books right now). But during their friendship I formed an independent bond with the other person because we all used to hang out a lot. Now I feel like I have to take sides.
System: That's a tough scenario to be in :) I firmly believe in talking this through with your partner. Though i don't know the specifics of why things went bad between your partner and his friend, but I believe things can always improve between friends.
User: I hope they do. Getting older already means smaller circles. It sucks to lose friends for arbitrary reasons. That's good advice though. I fear raising the issue might sound like treason. Lol.
System: True about that! I also think time helps to heal certain situations. So may be doing nothing is the best way forward.
User: AKA avoiding all texts from everyone?
System: Nope, that would be extreme. May be just putting some balance between the two options.
User: People always say to find a balance but never say what the balance is. It's used so often that it's vacuous.
System: Right, I guess that's because there is no one answer to this. It depends on what you value more and some factors around you. Also, life won't be interesting if others are figuring things out for you ;)
User: Lol. I'm finna be single.

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: How are you?
System: Everything is going extremely well. How are you?
User: I'm good thank you
System: Glad to hear it. What's new?
User: not much, and you?
System: Fair enough. So what would you like to talk about?
User: animals
System: Do you think it's right to keep animals locked up in a zoo?
User: no! what do you think?
System: But if they were out in the wild, someone might hunt them or shoot them for fun. Surely, they are safer locked up in the zoo? I think a lot of things.
User: what's the speed of cheetah?
System: It depends on the medium.
User: how much do bears weight?
System: More than a little, less than a lot.
User: tell me something fun

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How have you been
User: great! just came back from a ski trip
System: How was it? What trails did you ski on?
User: I slammed onto an ice wall, but I got better and turning after that haha
System: a resort in Montreal
User: Oh cool! do you know any french? I used to take french in high school but basically forgot most of it
System: Yeah I grew up speaking it. It's pretty much mandatory here
User: Did you go anywhere else in montreal?

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: What's the strangest dream you've ever had?
User: All my dreams are strange. Well, at least, most of them are.
System: What about the ones that aren't strange?
User: Do you sometimes have dreams that are completely mundane? I do. Then I wake up and think "Oh, how disappointing."
System: Yeah. But at least it's not a nightmare.
User: Right, fair point, I should count my blessings.
System: Yep. It doesn't have to be a fun dream, just not a nightmare!
User: I suddenly feel I should ask: am I dreaming now?
System: Do you think you're dreaming?
User: I'm not sure. This could be one of my mundane dreams about everyday life.
